txt.en: Fill water-skins in the waters of the river east of Aelin Veren ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

The river that flows through Aelin Veren can be found in central North Ithilien.\n\nMaendal has asked you to fill water-skins in the eastern waters of the river flowing through Aelin Veren before giving them to the prisoners.
Filled water-skins in the waters of the river east of Aelin Veren ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Travel east to the source of the river flowing through Aelin Veren
'I did not expect such treatment from these Rangers....'
'Why even bother, [placeholder]?'
The Haradrim prisoners can be found at Aelin Veren, in central North Ithilien.\n\nYou have returned with the filled water-skins and should now offer them to the Haradrim prisoners.

'An odd sort, these Men....

'We have heard they never take prisoners, and yet, here we are.

'Thank you, [placeholder]. This water soothes my ills....'
Offer filled water-skins to the Haradrim prisoners ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'You have my thanks. I have no love for these Men, but if bloodshed can be avoided this day, I shall do what I must.'
Talk to Maendal
Offered filled water-skins to the Haradrim prisoners ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'I hope it is enough to soothe their thirst for a time, [placeholder].

'I do not wish to offer them more than we can spare our own, but water is plentiful in these lands.

'Let us hope such a gesture gives them pause should they wish to attack us yet.'
Travel east to the source of the river flowing through Aelin Veren
You have left the freshest waters of the river!
dnt
You have come to the freshest waters of the river.
Maendal can be found at Aelin Veren in central North Ithilien.\n\nYou have offered a water-skin to each of the prisoners and should now speak to Maendal.
The Rangers of Ithilien do not often show mercy to their foes, but to hold prisoners demands a certain watchful care.

'[placeholder], a few of the Southrons have complained of thirst. I do not doubt it,  but I will not send my Rangers away from their sides. We still know little of their purpose here, and I dare not offer them the chance to slay us while our numbers are thinned.

'Still, I would not deny a prisoner such care, even one as hated as a Man of Harad. To the east of Aelin Veren lies the source of this river, beneath a great waterfall.

'I would ask that you take these water-skins and fill them there. When you return, offer them to the prisoners and let us hope it's enough to calm them for a time.

'If we are so fortunate, perhaps they may be more inclined to tell us of the Enemy's plots in Ithilien.'
Aid for the Enemy
